title: Point 1
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Declares class header: class CubePair

Canonical Solution: 

public class CubePair
{
   private Cube cube1;
   private Cube cube2;
 
   public CubePair(String type)
   {
      cube1 = new Cube(type);
      cube2 = new Cube(type);
   }
 
   public CubePair(String type1, String type2)
   {
      cube1 = new Cube(type1);
      cube2 = new Cube(type2);
   }
 
   public String rollCubes()
   {
      String result = "";
      result += cube1.roll();
      result += cube2.roll();
      return result;
   }
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • declare the class as private
  • include extraneous code outside the class

The response earns the point.

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • declare the class as private
  • include extraneous code outside the class

title: Point 2
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Declares two private Cube instance variables to represent each cube

Canonical Solution: 

public class CubePair
{
   private Cube cube1;
   private Cube cube2;
 
   public CubePair(String type)

   }

      String result = "";
      result += cube1.roll();
      result += cube2.roll();
      return result;

}

title: Point 3
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Declares two constructor headers: CubePair(String ___) and CubePair(String ___, String ___)

Canonical Solution: 

public class CubePair
{
   private Cube cube1;
   private Cube cube2;
 
   public CubePair(String type)

   public CubePair(String type1, String type2)
   {

   }
 
   public String rollCubes()
   {
      String result = "";
      result += cube1.roll();
      result += cube2.roll();

}

title: Point 4

title: Point 6
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Method calls roll on each cube and concatenates result (algorithm)

Canonical Solution: 

public class CubePair
{
   private Cube cube1;
   private Cube cube2;
 
   public CubePair(String type)
   {
      cube1 = new Cube(type);
      cube2 = new Cube(type);
   }
 
   public CubePair(String type1, String type2)
   {
      cube1 = new Cube(type1);
      cube2 = new Cube(type2);
   }
 
   public String rollCubes()
   {
      String result = "";
      result += cube1.roll();
      result += cube2.roll();
      return result;
   }
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • fail to return the string representing the two rolls
  • declare instance variables outside the class, or in the class within a method or constructor
  • construct new cubes for each roll, as long as they are of the appropriate cube type

The response earns the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • fail to return the string representing the two rolls
  • declare instance variables outside the class, or in the class within a method or constructor
  • construct new cubes for each roll, as long as they are of the appropriate cube type

title: Point 7
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria or to score the response.

To earn this point, responses must demonstrate the following:

  • Method returns concatenated string

Canonical Solution: 

public class CubePair
{
   private Cube cube1;
   private Cube cube2;
 
   public CubePair(String type)
   {
      cube1 = new Cube(type);
      cube2 = new Cube(type);
   }
 
   public CubePair(String type1, String type2)
   {
      cube1 = new Cube(type1);
      cube2 = new Cube(type2);
   }
 
   public String rollCubes()
   {
      String result = "";
      result += cube1.roll();
      result += cube2.roll();
      return result;
   }
}
descriptions:
The response does not earn the point.

Responses can still earn the point even if they

  • return an incorrect string

Responses will not earn the point if they

  • return a single String literal with no computation
  • return a non-String value
  • fail to return a value in some cases

The response earns the point.

  • return an incorrect string
